11194! real(kind=rb), parameter :: amc22 = 86.4688_rb ! Molecular weight of CFC22 (g/mol) - CHCLF2
11195! real(kind=rb), parameter :: amcl4 = 153.823_rb ! Molecular weight of CCL4 (g/mol) - CCL4
11196
11197! Set molecular weight ratios (for converting mmr to vmr)
11198! e.g. h2ovmr = h2ommr * amdw)
11199 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amdw = 1.607793_rb ! Molecular weight of dry air / water vapor
11200 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amdc = 0.658114_rb ! Molecular weight of dry air / carbon dioxide
11201 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amdo = 0.603428_rb ! Molecular weight of dry air / ozone
11202 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amdm = 1.805423_rb ! Molecular weight of dry air / methane
11203 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amdn = 0.658090_rb ! Molecular weight of dry air / nitrous oxide
11204 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amdo2 = 0.905140_rb ! Molecular weight of dry air / oxygen
11205 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amdc1 = 0.210852_rb ! Molecular weight of dry air / CFC11
11206 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amdc2 = 0.239546_rb ! Molecular weight of dry air / CFC12
11207
11208 integer(kind=im) :: isp, l, ix, n, imol, ib, ig ! Loop indices
11209 real(kind=rb) :: amm, amttl, wvttl, wvsh, summol
11210
11211! Add one to nlayers here to include extra model layer at top of atmosphere
11212 nlayers = nlay
11213
11214! Initialize all molecular amounts and cloud properties to zero here, then pass input amounts
11215! into RRTM arrays below.
11216
11217 wkl(:,:) = 0.0_rb
11218 wx(:,:) = 0.0_rb
11219 cldfmc(:,:) = 0.0_rb
11220 taucmc(:,:) = 0.0_rb
11221 ciwpmc(:,:) = 0.0_rb
11222 clwpmc(:,:) = 0.0_rb
11223 cswpmc(:,:) = 0.0_rb
11224 reicmc(:) = 0.0_rb
11225 relqmc(:) = 0.0_rb
11226 resnmc(:) = 0.0_rb
11227 taua(:,:) = 0.0_rb
11228 amttl = 0.0_rb
11229 wvttl = 0.0_rb
11230
11231! Set surface temperature.
11232 tbound = tsfc(iplon)
11233
11234! Install input GCM arrays into RRTMG_LW arrays for pressure, temperature,
11235! and molecular amounts.
11236! Pressures are input in mb, or are converted to mb here.
11237! Molecular amounts are input in volume mixing ratio, or are converted from
11238! mass mixing ratio (or specific humidity for h2o) to volume mixing ratio
11239! here. These are then converted to molecular amount (molec/cm2) below.
11240! The dry air column COLDRY (in molec/cm2) is calculated from the level
11241! pressures, pz (in mb), based on the hydrostatic equation and includes a
11242! correction to account for h2o in the layer. The molecular weight of moist
11243! air (amm) is calculated for each layer.
11244! Note: In RRTMG, layer indexing goes from bottom to top, and coding below
11245! assumes GCM input fields are also bottom to top. Input layer indexing
11246! from GCM fields should be reversed here if necessary.
11247
11248 pz(0) = plev(iplon,1)
11249 tz(0) = tlev(iplon,1)
11250 do l = 1, nlayers
11251 pavel(l) = play(iplon,l)
11252 tavel(l) = tlay(iplon,l)
11253 pz(l) = plev(iplon,l+1)
11254 tz(l) = tlev(iplon,l+1)
11255! For h2o input in vmr:
11256 wkl(1,l) = h2ovmr(iplon,l)
11257! For h2o input in mmr:
11258! wkl(1,l) = h2o(iplon,l)*amdw
11259! For h2o input in specific humidity;
11260! wkl(1,l) = (h2o(iplon,l)/(1._rb - h2o(iplon,l)))*amdw
11261 wkl(2,l) = co2vmr(iplon,l)
11262 wkl(3,l) = o3vmr(iplon,l)
11263 wkl(4,l) = n2ovmr(iplon,l)
11264 wkl(6,l) = ch4vmr(iplon,l)
11265 wkl(7,l) = o2vmr(iplon,l)
11266 amm = (1._rb - wkl(1,l)) * amd + wkl(1,l) * amw
11267 coldry(l) = (pz(l-1)-pz(l)) * 1.e3_rb * avogad / &
11268 (1.e2_rb * grav * amm * (1._rb + wkl(1,l)))
11269 enddo
11270
11271! Set cross section molecule amounts from input; convert to vmr if necessary
11272 do l=1, nlayers
11273 wx(1,l) = ccl4vmr(iplon,l)
11274 wx(2,l) = cfc11vmr(iplon,l)
11275 wx(3,l) = cfc12vmr(iplon,l)
11276 wx(4,l) = cfc22vmr(iplon,l)
11277 enddo
11278
11279! The following section can be used to set values for an additional layer (from
11280! the GCM top level to 1.e-4 mb) for improved calculation of TOA fluxes.
11281! Temperature and molecular amounts in the extra model layer are set to
11282! their values in the top GCM model layer, though these can be modified
11283! here if necessary.
11284! If this feature is utilized, increase nlayers by one above, limit the two
11285! loops above to (nlayers-1), and set the top most (extra) layer values here.
11286
11287! pavel(nlayers) = 0.5_rb * pz(nlayers-1)
11288! tavel(nlayers) = tavel(nlayers-1)
11289! pz(nlayers) = 1.e-4_rb
11290! tz(nlayers-1) = 0.5_rb * (tavel(nlayers)+tavel(nlayers-1))
11291! tz(nlayers) = tz(nlayers-1)
11292! wkl(1,nlayers) = wkl(1,nlayers-1)
11293! wkl(2,nlayers) = wkl(2,nlayers-1)
11294! wkl(3,nlayers) = wkl(3,nlayers-1)
11295! wkl(4,nlayers) = wkl(4,nlayers-1)
11296! wkl(6,nlayers) = wkl(6,nlayers-1)
11297! wkl(7,nlayers) = wkl(7,nlayers-1)
11298! amm = (1._rb - wkl(1,nlayers-1)) * amd + wkl(1,nlayers-1) * amw
11299! coldry(nlayers) = (pz(nlayers-1)) * 1.e3_rb * avogad / &
11300! (1.e2_rb * grav * amm * (1._rb + wkl(1,nlayers-1)))
11301! wx(1,nlayers) = wx(1,nlayers-1)
11302! wx(2,nlayers) = wx(2,nlayers-1)
11303! wx(3,nlayers) = wx(3,nlayers-1)
11304! wx(4,nlayers) = wx(4,nlayers-1)
11305
11306! At this point all molecular amounts in wkl and wx are in volume mixing ratio;
11307! convert to molec/cm2 based on coldry for use in rrtm. also, compute precipitable
11308! water vapor for diffusivity angle adjustments in rtrn and rtrnmr.
11309
11310 do l = 1, nlayers
11311 summol = 0.0_rb
11312 do imol = 2, nmol
11313 summol = summol + wkl(imol,l)
11314 enddo
11315 wbrodl(l) = coldry(l) * (1._rb - summol)
11316 do imol = 1, nmol
11317 wkl(imol,l) = coldry(l) * wkl(imol,l)
11318 enddo
11319 amttl = amttl + coldry(l)+wkl(1,l)
11320 wvttl = wvttl + wkl(1,l)
11321 do ix = 1,maxxsec
11322 if (ixindx(ix) .ne. 0) then
11323 wx(ixindx(ix),l) = coldry(l) * wx(ix,l) * 1.e-20_rb
11324 endif
11325 enddo
11326 enddo
11327
11328 wvsh = (amw * wvttl) / (amd * amttl)
11329 pwvcm = wvsh * (1.e3_rb * pz(0)) / (1.e2_rb * grav)
11330
11331! Set spectral surface emissivity for each longwave band.
11332
11333 do n=1,nbndlw
11334 semiss(n) = emis(iplon,n)
11335! semiss(n) = 1.0_rb
11336 enddo
11337
11338! Transfer aerosol optical properties to RRTM variable;
11339! modify to reverse layer indexing here if necessary.
11340
11341 if (iaer .ge. 1) then
11342 do l = 1, nlayers
11343 do ib = 1, nbndlw
11344 taua(l,ib) = tauaer(iplon,l,ib)
11345 enddo
11346 enddo
11347 endif
11348
11349! Transfer cloud fraction and cloud optical properties to RRTM variables,
11350! modify to reverse layer indexing here if necessary.
11351
11352 if (icld .ge. 1) then
11353 inflag = inflglw
11354 iceflag = iceflglw
11355 liqflag = liqflglw
11356
11357! Move incoming GCM cloud arrays to RRTMG cloud arrays.
11358! For GCM input, incoming reicmcl is defined based on selected ice parameterization (inflglw)
11359
11360 do l = 1, nlayers
11361 do ig = 1, ngptlw
11362 cldfmc(ig,l) = cldfmcl(ig,iplon,l)
11363 taucmc(ig,l) = taucmcl(ig,iplon,l)
11364 ciwpmc(ig,l) = ciwpmcl(ig,iplon,l)
11365 clwpmc(ig,l) = clwpmcl(ig,iplon,l)
11366 cswpmc(ig,l) = cswpmcl(ig,iplon,l)
11367 enddo
11368 reicmc(l) = reicmcl(iplon,l)
11369 relqmc(l) = relqmcl(iplon,l)
11370 resnmc(l) = resnmcl(iplon,l)
11371 enddo
11372
11373! If an extra layer is being used in RRTMG, set all cloud properties to zero in the extra layer.
11374
11375! cldfmc(:,nlayers) = 0.0_rb
11376! taucmc(:,nlayers) = 0.0_rb
11377! ciwpmc(:,nlayers) = 0.0_rb
11378! clwpmc(:,nlayers) = 0.0_rb
11379! reicmc(nlayers) = 0.0_rb
11380! relqmc(nlayers) = 0.0_rb
11381! taua(nlayers,:) = 0.0_rb
11382
11383 endif
11384
11385 end subroutine inatm
11386
11387 end module rrtmg_lw_rad
11388
11389!------------------------------------------------------------------
11390MODULE module_ra_rrtmg_lw
11391
11392#if defined(mpas)
11393!MPAS specific (Laura D. Fowler):
11394use mpas_atmphys_constants,only : cp,g=>gravity
11395use module_ra_rrtmg_vinterp,only: vinterp_ozn
11396
11426
11427!MPAS specific end.
11428
11429#else
11430use module_model_constants, only : cp
11431use module_wrf_error
11432#define FATAL_ERROR(M) call wrf_error_fatal( M )
11433#if (HWRF == 1)
11434 USE module_state_description, ONLY : fer_mp_hires, fer_mp_hires_advect, etamp_hwrf
11435#else
11436 USE module_state_description, ONLY : fer_mp_hires, fer_mp_hires_advect
11437#endif
11438!use module_dm
11439#endif
11440
11441use parrrtm, only : nbndlw, ngptlw
11442use rrtmg_lw_init, only: rrtmg_lw_ini
11443use rrtmg_lw_rad, only: rrtmg_lw
11444use mcica_subcol_gen_lw, only: mcica_subcol_lw
11445
11446 real retab(95)
11447 data retab / &
11448 5.92779, 6.26422, 6.61973, 6.99539, 7.39234, &
11449 7.81177, 8.25496, 8.72323, 9.21800, 9.74075, 10.2930, &
11450 10.8765, 11.4929, 12.1440, 12.8317, 13.5581, 14.2319, &
11451 15.0351, 15.8799, 16.7674, 17.6986, 18.6744, 19.6955, &
11452 20.7623, 21.8757, 23.0364, 24.2452, 25.5034, 26.8125, &
11453 27.7895, 28.6450, 29.4167, 30.1088, 30.7306, 31.2943, &
11454 31.8151, 32.3077, 32.7870, 33.2657, 33.7540, 34.2601, &
11455 34.7892, 35.3442, 35.9255, 36.5316, 37.1602, 37.8078, &
11456 38.4720, 39.1508, 39.8442, 40.5552, 41.2912, 42.0635, &
11457 42.8876, 43.7863, 44.7853, 45.9170, 47.2165, 48.7221, &
11458 50.4710, 52.4980, 54.8315, 57.4898, 60.4785, 63.7898, &
11459 65.5604, 71.2885, 75.4113, 79.7368, 84.2351, 88.8833, &
11460 93.6658, 98.5739, 103.603, 108.752, 114.025, 119.424, &
11461 124.954, 130.630, 136.457, 142.446, 148.608, 154.956, &
11462 161.503, 168.262, 175.248, 182.473, 189.952, 197.699, &
11463 205.728, 214.055, 222.694, 231.661, 240.971, 250.639/
11464 !
11465 save retab
11466#if !defined(mpas)
11467 ! For buffer layer adjustment. Steven Cavallo, Dec 2010.
11468 integer , save :: nlayers
11469#endif
11470 real, PARAMETER :: deltap = 4. ! Pressure interval for buffer layer in mb
11471
11472contains
11473
11474!=================================================================================================================
11475 subroutine rrtmg_lwrad( &
11476 p3d,p8w,pi3d,t3d,t8w,dz8w,qv3d,qc3d,qr3d, &
11477 qi3d,qs3d,qg3d,cldfra3d,o33d,tsk,emiss, &
11478 xland,xice,snow,icloud,o3input,noznlevels, &
11479 pin,o3clim,glw,olr,lwcf,rthratenlw, &
11480 has_reqc,has_reqi,has_reqs,re_cloud, &
11481 re_ice,re_snow,rre_cloud,rre_ice,rre_snow, &
11482 lwupt,lwuptc,lwdnt,lwdntc, &
11483 lwupb,lwupbc,lwdnb,lwdnbc, &
11484 lwupflx, lwupflxc, lwdnflx, lwdnflxc, &
11485 ids,ide, jds,jde, kds,kde, &
11486 ims,ime, jms,jme, kms,kme, &
11487 its,ite, jts,jte, kts,kte &
11488 )
11489
11490 implicit none
11491
11492!=================================================================================================================
11493
11494!--- input arguments:
11495 integer,intent(in):: ids,ide, jds,jde, kds,kde, &
11496 ims,ime, jms,jme, kms,kme, &
11497 its,ite, jts,jte, kts,kte
11498 integer,intent(in):: icloud,has_reqc,has_reqi,has_reqs
11499 integer,intent(in),optional:: o3input
11500
11501 real,intent(in),dimension(ims:ime,jms:jme):: emiss,tsk,snow,xice,xland
11502 real,intent(in),dimension(ims:ime,kms:kme,jms:jme):: t3d,p3d,pi3d
11503 real,intent(in),dimension(ims:ime,kms:kme,jms:jme):: dz8w,p8w,t8w
11504
11505 real,intent(in),dimension(ims:ime,kms:kme,jms:jme):: re_cloud,re_ice,re_snow
11506 real,intent(in),dimension(ims:ime,kms:kme,jms:jme),optional:: &
11507 cldfra3d,qv3d,qc3d,qr3d,qi3d,qs3d,qg3d,o33d
11508
11509!--- additional input arguments to use the CAM ozone climatology:
11510 integer,intent(in):: noznlevels
11511 real,intent(in),dimension(1:noznlevels),optional:: pin
11512 real,intent(in),dimension(ims:ime,1:noznlevels,jms:jme),optional:: o3clim
11513
11514!--- inout arguments:
11515 real,intent(inout),dimension(ims:ime,jms:jme):: glw,olr,lwcf
11516 real,intent(inout),dimension(ims:ime,jms:jme),optional:: &
11517 lwupt,lwuptc,lwdnt,lwdntc,lwupb,lwupbc,lwdnb,lwdnbc
11518
11519 real,intent(inout),dimension(ims:ime,kms:kme,jms:jme):: rthratenlw
11520
11521!--- output arguments:
11522 real,intent(out),dimension(ims:ime,kms:kme,jms:jme),optional:: &
11523 rre_cloud,rre_ice,rre_snow
11524 real,intent(out),dimension(ims:ime,kms:kme+2,jms:jme ),optional:: &
11525 lwupflx,lwupflxc,lwdnflx,lwdnflxc
11526
11527!local variables and arrays:
11528 integer:: nb,ncol,nlay,icld,inflglw,iceflglw,liqflglw
11529 integer:: iplon,irng,permuteseed
11530 integer:: pcols,pver
11531 integer:: idx_rei
11532 integer:: i,j,k,kk,n
11533
11534 real:: ro,dz
11535 real:: corr
11536 real:: gliqwp,gicewp,gsnowp,gravmks
11537 real:: snow_mass_factor
11538 real,dimension(1):: tsfc,landfrac,landm,snowh,icefrac
11539 real,dimension(1,1:kte-kts+1):: pdel,cliqwp,cicewp,csnowp,reliq,reice,resnow
11540 real,dimension(1,nbndlw):: emis
11541
11542 real,dimension(kts:kte):: &
11543 tten1d,cldfra1d,dz1d,p1d,t1d,qv1d,qc1d,qr1d,qi1d,qs1d,qg1d,o31d
11544 real,dimension(kts:kte+1):: pw1d,tw1d
11545
11546!--- additional local variables and arrays needed to include additional layers between the model top
11547! and the top of the atmosphere:
11548 integer,dimension(its:ite,jts:jte):: mpas_nlay
11549
11550 real,dimension(:),allocatable:: o3mmr,varint
11551 real,dimension(:,:),allocatable:: &
11552 plev,tlev,play,tlay,h2ovmr,o3vmr,co2vmr,o2vmr,ch4vmr,n2ovmr,cfc11vmr, &
11553 cfc12vmr,cfc22vmr,ccl4vmr,clwpth,ciwpth,cswpth,rel,rei,res,cldfrac,relqmcl,reicmcl,resnmcl
11554 real,dimension(:,:),allocatable:: uflx,dflx,uflxc,dflxc,hr,hrc
11555 real,dimension(:,:,:),allocatable:: taucld,cldfmcl,clwpmcl,ciwpmcl,cswpmcl,taucmcl,tauaer
11556
11557!--- additional local variables and arrays needed for the CAM ozone climatologyL
11558 real,dimension(1:noznlevels):: o3clim1d
11559
11560#if defined(mpas)
11561!MPAS specific (Dom Heinzeller):
11562 integer:: nlayers
11563#endif
11564
11565!--- set trace gas volume mixing ratios, 2005 values, IPCC (2007):
11566!carbon dioxide (379 ppmv)
11567 real :: co2
11568 data co2 / 379.e-6 /
11569!methane (1774 ppbv)
11570 real :: ch4
11571 data ch4 / 1774.e-9 /
11572!nitrous oxide (319 ppbv)
11573 real :: n2o
11574 data n2o / 319.e-9 /
11575!cfc-11 (251 ppt)
11576 real :: cfc11
11577 data cfc11 / 0.251e-9 /
11578!cfc-12 (538 ppt)
11579 real :: cfc12
11580 data cfc12 / 0.538e-9 /
11581!cfc-22 (169 ppt)
11582 real :: cfc22
11583 data cfc22 / 0.169e-9 /
11584!ccl4 (93 ppt)
11585 real :: ccl4
11586 data ccl4 / 0.093e-9 /
11587
11588!--- set oxygen volume mixing ratio (for o2mmr=0.23143):
11589 real :: o2
11590 data o2 / 0.209488 /
11591
11592!--- molecular weights and ratios for converting mmr to vmr units
11593! real :: amd ! Effective molecular weight of dry air (g/mol)
11594! real :: amw ! Molecular weight of water vapor (g/mol)
11595! real :: amo ! Molecular weight of ozone (g/mol)
11596! real :: amo2 ! Molecular weight of oxygen (g/mol)
11597! Atomic weights for conversion from mass to volume mixing ratios
11598! data amd / 28.9660 /
11599! data amw / 18.0160 /
11600! data amo / 47.9998 /
11601! data amo2 / 31.9999 /
11602
11603 real :: amdw ! Molecular weight of dry air / water vapor
11604 real :: amdo ! Molecular weight of dry air / ozone
11605 real :: amdo2 ! Molecular weight of dry air / oxygen
11606 data amdw / 1.607793 /
11607 data amdo / 0.603461 /
11608 data amdo2 / 0.905190 /
11609
11610!--- added for top of model adjustment. Steven Cavallo NCAR/MMM December 2010
11611 integer,parameter:: nproflevs = 60 ! Constant, from the table
11612 integer:: klev
11613
11614 real:: wght,vark,vark1
11615 real,dimension(nproflevs):: pprof,tprof
11616
11617!--- weighted mean pressure and temperature profiles from midlatitude summer (MLS),
11618! midlatitude winter (MLW), sub-Arctic winter (SAW),sub-Arctic summer (SAS),
11619! and tropical (TROP) standard atmospheres.
11620 data pprof /1000.00,855.47,731.82,626.05,535.57,458.16, &
11621 391.94,335.29,286.83,245.38,209.91,179.57, &
11622 153.62,131.41,112.42, 96.17, 82.27, 70.38, &
11623 60.21, 51.51, 44.06, 37.69, 32.25, 27.59, &
11624 23.60, 20.19, 17.27, 14.77, 12.64, 10.81, &
11625 9.25, 7.91, 6.77, 5.79, 4.95, 4.24, &
11626 3.63, 3.10, 2.65, 2.27, 1.94, 1.66, &
11627 1.42, 1.22, 1.04, 0.89, 0.76, 0.65, &
11628 0.56, 0.48, 0.41, 0.35, 0.30, 0.26, &
11629 0.22, 0.19, 0.16, 0.14, 0.12, 0.10/
11630 data tprof /286.96,281.07,275.16,268.11,260.56,253.02, &
11631 245.62,238.41,231.57,225.91,221.72,217.79, &
11632 215.06,212.74,210.25,210.16,210.69,212.14, &
11633 213.74,215.37,216.82,217.94,219.03,220.18, &
11634 221.37,222.64,224.16,225.88,227.63,229.51, &
11635 231.50,233.73,236.18,238.78,241.60,244.44, &
11636 247.35,250.33,253.32,256.30,259.22,262.12, &
11637 264.80,266.50,267.59,268.44,268.69,267.76, &
11638 266.13,263.96,261.54,258.93,256.15,253.23, &
11639 249.89,246.67,243.48,240.25,236.66,233.86/
11640
11641!-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
11642
11643!--- all fields are ordered vertically from bottom to top (pressures are in mb):
11644 ncol = 1
11645
11646!--- initialize option for the calculation of the cloud optical properties:
11647 icld = 2 ! with clouds using maximum/random cloud overlap in subroutine mcica_subcol_lw.
11648 inflglw = 2
11649 iceflglw = 3
11650 liqflglw = 1
11651
11652!--- latitude loop:
11653 j_loop: do j = jts,jte
11654
11655!--- longitude loop:
11656 i_loop: do i = its,ite
11657
11658 !--- set surface emissivity in each RRTMG longwave band:
11659 do nb = 1, nbndlw
11660 emis(ncol,nb) = emiss(i,j)
11661 enddo
11662
11663
11664
11665 !--- INITIALIZE COLUMN SOUNDING (the call to the long wave radiation code is done one column at a time
11666 ! which is why we set ncol = 1 above):
11667 do k = kts, kte+1
11668 pw1d(k) = p8w(i,k,j) / 100.
11669 tw1d(k) = t8w(i,k,j)
11670 enddo
11671
11672 do k = kts, kte
11673 p1d(k) = p3d(i,k,j) / 100.
11674 dz1d(k) = dz8w(i,k,j)
11675 t1d(k) = t3d(i,k,j)
11676 qv1d(k) = amax1(qv3d(i,k,j),1.e-12)
11677 o31d(k) = 0.
11678 qc1d(k) = 0.
11679 qr1d(k) = 0.
11680 qi1d(k) = 0.
11681 qs1d(k) = 0.
11682 qg1d(k) = 0.
11683 cldfra1d(k) = 0.
11684 if(present(o33d)) o31d(k) = o33d(i,k,j)
11685 enddo
11686
11687 !--- initialize the local arrays containing the different cloud water and ice condenstates:
11688 if(icloud .gt. 0) then
11689 do k = kts,kte
11690 if(present(qc3d)) qc1d(k) = amax1(qc3d(i,k,j),0.)
11691 if(present(qr3d)) qr1d(k) = amax1(qr3d(i,k,j),0.)
11692 if(present(qi3d)) qi1d(k) = amax1(qi3d(i,k,j),0.)
11693 if(present(qs3d)) qs1d(k) = amax1(qs3d(i,k,j),0.)
11694 if((present(qc3d) .or. present(qi3d) .or. present(qs3d)) .and. present(cldfra3d)) &
11695 cldfra1d(k) = cldfra3d(i,k,j)
11696 enddo
11697 endif
11698
11699 !--- initialize the local radiative heating rate:
11700 do k = kts, kte
11701 tten1d(k) = 0.
11702 enddo
11703
11704 !--- add extra layers to include absorption and transmission between the top of the model and the top of
11705 ! the atmosphere: in contrast to WRF, MPAS columns have different model-top pressures since MPAS uses
11706 ! a height coordinate system. Therefore, we define nlayers for each individual column:
11707 nlayers = kte + max(nint(pw1d(kte+1)/deltap), 1)
11708 mpas_nlay(i,j) = nlayers-kte
11709! write(0,101) j,i,kme,kte,nlayers,mpas_nlay(i,j),pw1d(kte+1),pw1d(kte+1)-mpas_nlay(i,j)*deltap
11710! 101 format(6i9,3(1x,f9.4))
11711 if(.not.allocated(o3mmr) ) allocate(o3mmr(kts:nlayers) )
11712 if(.not.allocated(varint) ) allocate(varint(kts:nlayers+1) )
11713 if(.not.allocated(plev) ) allocate(plev(1,kts:nlayers+1) )
11714 if(.not.allocated(tlev) ) allocate(tlev(1,kts:nlayers+1) )
11715 if(.not.allocated(play) ) allocate(play(1,kts:nlayers) )
11716 if(.not.allocated(tlay) ) allocate(tlay(1,kts:nlayers) )
11717 if(.not.allocated(h2ovmr) ) allocate(h2ovmr(1,kts:nlayers) )
11718 if(.not.allocated(o3vmr) ) allocate(o3vmr(1,kts:nlayers) )
11719 if(.not.allocated(co2vmr) ) allocate(co2vmr(1,kts:nlayers) )
11720 if(.not.allocated(o2vmr) ) allocate(o2vmr(1,kts:nlayers) )
11721 if(.not.allocated(ch4vmr) ) allocate(ch4vmr(1,kts:nlayers) )
11722 if(.not.allocated(n2ovmr) ) allocate(n2ovmr(1,kts:nlayers) )
11723 if(.not.allocated(cfc11vmr)) allocate(cfc11vmr(1,kts:nlayers))
11724 if(.not.allocated(cfc12vmr)) allocate(cfc12vmr(1,kts:nlayers))
11725 if(.not.allocated(cfc22vmr)) allocate(cfc22vmr(1,kts:nlayers))
11726 if(.not.allocated(ccl4vmr) ) allocate(ccl4vmr(1,kts:nlayers) )
11727 if(.not.allocated(clwpth) ) allocate(clwpth(1,kts:nlayers) )
11728 if(.not.allocated(ciwpth) ) allocate(ciwpth(1,kts:nlayers) )
11729 if(.not.allocated(cswpth) ) allocate(cswpth(1,kts:nlayers) )
11730 if(.not.allocated(rel) ) allocate(rel(1,kts:nlayers) )
11731 if(.not.allocated(rei) ) allocate(rei(1,kts:nlayers) )
11732 if(.not.allocated(res) ) allocate(res(1,kts:nlayers) )
11733 if(.not.allocated(cldfrac) ) allocate(cldfrac(1,kts:nlayers) )
11734 if(.not.allocated(relqmcl) ) allocate(relqmcl(1,kts:nlayers) )
11735 if(.not.allocated(reicmcl) ) allocate(reicmcl(1,kts:nlayers) )
11736 if(.not.allocated(resnmcl) ) allocate(resnmcl(1,kts:nlayers) )
11737 if(.not.allocated(uflx) ) allocate(uflx(1,kts:nlayers+1) )
11738 if(.not.allocated(dflx) ) allocate(dflx(1,kts:nlayers+1) )
11739 if(.not.allocated(uflxc) ) allocate(uflxc(1,kts:nlayers+1) )
11740 if(.not.allocated(dflxc) ) allocate(dflxc(1,kts:nlayers+1) )
11741 if(.not.allocated(hr) ) allocate(hr(1,kts:nlayers) )
11742 if(.not.allocated(hrc) ) allocate(hrc(1,kts:nlayers) )
11743 if(.not.allocated(taucld) ) allocate(taucld(nbndlw,1,kts:nlayers) )
11744 if(.not.allocated(cldfmcl) ) allocate(cldfmcl(ngptlw,1,kts:nlayers))
11745 if(.not.allocated(clwpmcl) ) allocate(clwpmcl(ngptlw,1,kts:nlayers))
11746 if(.not.allocated(ciwpmcl) ) allocate(ciwpmcl(ngptlw,1,kts:nlayers))
11747 if(.not.allocated(cswpmcl) ) allocate(cswpmcl(ngptlw,1,kts:nlayers))
11748 if(.not.allocated(taucmcl) ) allocate(taucmcl(ngptlw,1,kts:nlayers))
11749 if(.not.allocated(tauaer) ) allocate(tauaer(1,kts:nlayers,nbndlw) )
11750
11751 nlay = nlayers ! keep these indices the same.
11752
11753 !--- initialize local arrays called in the calculation of the cloud optical properties and radiative
11754 ! fluxes:
11755 do n = 1, ncol
11756 do k = kts, kte
11757 reliq(ncol,k) = 10.
11758 reice(ncol,k) = 10.
11759 resnow(ncol,k) = 10.
11760 cliqwp(ncol,k) = 0.
11761 cicewp(ncol,k) = 0.
11762 csnowp(ncol,k) = 0.
11763 enddo
11764
11765 do k = 1, nlayers
11766 clwpth(n,k) = 0.
11767 ciwpth(n,k) = 0.
11768 cswpth(n,k) = 0.
11769 rel(n,k) = 0.
11770 rei(n,k) = 0.
11771 res(n,k) = 0.
11772 cldfrac(n,k) = 0.
11773 relqmcl(n,k) = 0.
11774 reicmcl(n,k) = 0.
11775 resnmcl(n,k) = 0.
11776 uflx(n,k) = 0.
11777 uflxc(n,k) = 0.
11778 dflx(n,k) = 0.
11779 dflxc(n,k) = 0.
11780 hr(n,k) = 0.
11781 hrc(n,k) = 0.
11782 taucld(1:nbndlw,n,k) = 0.
11783 tauaer(n,k,1:nbndlw) = 0.
11784 cldfmcl(1:ngptlw,n,k) = 0.
11785 clwpmcl(1:ngptlw,n,k) = 0.
11786 ciwpmcl(1:ngptlw,n,k) = 0.
11787 cswpmcl(1:ngptlw,n,k) = 0.
11788 taucmcl(1:ngptlw,n,k) = 0.
11789 enddo
11790 uflx(n,nlayers+1) = 0.
11791 uflxc(n,nlayers+1) = 0.
11792 dflx(n,nlayers+1) = 0.
11793 dflxc(n,nlayers+1) = 0.
11794 enddo
11795
11796 !--- fill local arrays with input sounding. convert water vapor mass mixing ratio to volume mixing ratio:
11797 plev(ncol,1) = pw1d(1)
11798 tlev(ncol,1) = tw1d(1)
11799 tsfc(ncol) = tsk(i,j)
11800 do k = kts, kte
11801 plev(ncol,k+1) = pw1d(k+1)
11802 tlev(ncol,k+1) = tw1d(k+1)
11803 play(ncol,k) = p1d(k)
11804 pdel(ncol,k) = plev(ncol,k) - plev(ncol,k+1)
11805 tlay(ncol,k) = t1d(k)
11806 h2ovmr(ncol,k) = qv1d(k) * amdw
11807 co2vmr(ncol,k) = co2
11808 o2vmr(ncol,k) = o2
11809 ch4vmr(ncol,k) = ch4
11810 n2ovmr(ncol,k) = n2o
11811 cfc11vmr(ncol,k) = cfc11
11812 cfc12vmr(ncol,k) = cfc12
11813 cfc22vmr(ncol,k) = cfc22
11814 ccl4vmr(ncol,k) = ccl4
11815 enddo
11816
11817 !--- the sourcecode below follows Steven Cavallo's method to "fill" the atmospheric layers between the
11818 ! top of the model and the top of the atmosphere. check if the pressure at the top of the atmosphere
11819 ! is negative. if negative, set it to zero prior to the calculation of temperatures (tlev and tlay):
11820 do k=kte+1,nlayers,1
11821 plev(ncol,k+1) = max(plev(ncol,k) - deltap, 0.00)
11822 play(ncol,k) = 0.5*(plev(ncol,k) + plev(ncol,k+1))
11823 enddo
11824
11825 !--- add zero as top level. this gets the temperature max at the stratopause, reducing downward flux
11826 ! errors in the top levels. If zero happened to be the top level already, this will add another
11827 ! level with zero, but will not affect the radiative transfer calculation.
11828 plev(ncol,nlayers+1) = 0.00
11829 play(ncol,nlayers) = 0.5*(plev(ncol,nlayers) + plev(ncol,nlayers+1))
11830
11831 !--- interpolate the table temperatures to column pressure levels:
11832 do k = 1, nlayers+1, 1
11833 if(pprof(nproflevs) .lt. plev(ncol,k)) then
11834 do kk = 2, nproflevs, 1
11835 if(pprof(kk) .lt. plev(ncol,k)) then
11836 klev = kk - 1
11837 exit
11838 endif
11839 enddo
11840 else
11841 klev = nproflevs
11842 endif
11843
11844 if(klev .ne. nproflevs) then
11845 vark = tprof(klev)
11846 vark1 = tprof(klev+1)
11847 wght = (plev(ncol,k)-pprof(klev) )/( pprof(klev+1)-pprof(klev))
11848 else
11849 vark = tprof(klev)
11850 vark1 = tprof(klev)
11851 wght = 0.0
11852 endif
11853 varint(k) = wght*(vark1-vark)+vark
11854 enddo
11855
11856 !--- match the interpolated table temperature profile:
11857 do k = kte+1, nlayers+1, 1
11858 tlev(ncol,k) = varint(k) + (tlev(ncol,kte) - varint(kte))
11859 !if(k .le. nlay) then
11860 tlay(ncol,k-1) = 0.5*(tlev(ncol,k) + tlev(ncol,k-1))
11861 !endif
11862 enddo
11863
11864 !--- fill water vapor and chemical species volume mixing ratios, except ozone:
11865 do k = kte+1, nlayers, 1
11866 h2ovmr(ncol,k) = h2ovmr(ncol,kte)
11867 co2vmr(ncol,k) = co2vmr(ncol,kte)
11868 o2vmr(ncol,k) = o2vmr(ncol,kte)
11869 ch4vmr(ncol,k) = ch4vmr(ncol,kte)
11870 n2ovmr(ncol,k) = n2ovmr(ncol,kte)
11871 cfc11vmr(ncol,k) = cfc11vmr(ncol,kte)
11872 cfc12vmr(ncol,k) = cfc12vmr(ncol,kte)
11873 cfc22vmr(ncol,k) = cfc22vmr(ncol,kte)
11874 ccl4vmr(ncol,k) = ccl4vmr(ncol,kte)
11875 enddo
11876
11877 !--- initialize the ozone voume mixing ratio:
11878 call inirad(o3mmr,plev,kts,nlayers-1)
11879 if(o3input .eq. 2) then
11880 do k = 1, noznlevels
11881 o3clim1d(k) = o3clim(i,k,j)
11882 enddo
11883 call vinterp_ozn(1,ncol,ncol,nlayers,play,pin,noznlevels,o3clim1d,o3mmr)
11884 do k = kts,nlayers
11885 o3vmr(ncol,k) = o3mmr(k)
11886 enddo
11887 else
11888 do k = kts,nlayers
11889 o3vmr(ncol,k) = o3mmr(k)*amdo
11890 enddo
11891 endif
11892
11893
11894
11895 !--- CALCULATE CLOUD OPTICAL PROPERTIES:
11896 if(inflglw .gt. 0) then
11897
11898 do k = kts, kte
11899 cldfrac(ncol,k) = cldfra1d(k)
11900 enddo
11901
11902 !--- zero out cloud optical properties here (not used when passing physical properties to rrtmg_lw as
11903 ! taucld is calculated in radiation:
11904 do k = kts, kte
11905 do nb = 1, nbndlw
11906 taucld(nb,ncol,k) = 0.0
11907 enddo
11908 enddo
11909
11910 pcols = ncol
11911 pver = kte - kts + 1
11912 gravmks = g
11913
11914 if(has_reqc .ne. 0) then
11915 !--- fill the effective radius for cloud water with that calculated in the Thompson cloud
11916 ! microphysics parameterization:
11917 inflglw = 3
11918 do k = kts, kte
11919 reliq(ncol,k) = max(2.5,re_cloud(i,k,j)*1.e6)
11920 if(reliq(ncol,k).le.2.5 .and. cldfrac(ncol,k).gt.0. .and. &
11921 (xland(i,j)-1.5).gt.0.) then !--- ocean.
11922 reliq(ncol,k) = 10.5
11923 elseif(reliq(ncol,k).le.2.5 .and. cldfrac(ncol,k).gt.0. .and. &
11924 (xland(i,j)-1.5).lt.0.) then !--- land.
11925 reliq(ncol,k) = 7.5
11926 endif
11927 enddo
11928
11929 else
11930
11931 !--- calculate the effective radius for cloud water in layers below the model top. we added the
11932 ! dimensions pcols, pver so that the calls to subroutines relcalc and reicalc remain the same
11933 ! as in WRF although the two dimensions are duplicate and not needed inside the subroutines:
11934 landfrac(ncol) = 2.-xland(i,j)
11935 landm(ncol) = landfrac(ncol)
11936 snowh(ncol) = 0.001*snow(i,j)
11937 icefrac(ncol) = xice(i,j)
11938
11939 call relcalc(ncol,pcols,pver,tlay,landfrac,landm,icefrac,reliq,snowh)
11940 endif
11941
11942 if(has_reqi .ne. 0) then
11943 !--- fill the effective radius for cloud ice with that calculated in the Thompson cloud
11944 ! microphysics parameterization:
11945 inflglw = 4
11946 iceflglw = 4
11947 do k = kts, kte
11948 reice(ncol,k) = max(5.,re_ice(i,k,j)*1.e6)
11949 if(reice(ncol,k).le.5. .and. cldfrac(ncol,k).gt.0.) then
11950 idx_rei = int(t3d(i,k,j)-179.)
11951 idx_rei = min(max(idx_rei,1),75)
11952 corr = t3d(i,k,j) - int(t3d(i,k,j))
11953 reice(ncol,k) = retab(idx_rei)*(1.-corr) + retab(idx_rei+1)*corr
11954 reice(ncol,k) = max(reice(ncol,k),5.0)
11955 endif
11956 enddo
11957
11958 else
11959
11960 !--- calculate the effective radius for cloud ice in layers below the model top, following
11961 ! Kristjansson and Mitchell. limit upper bound of reice for Fu ice parameterization and
11962 ! convert effective radius to generalized effective size (*1.0315; Fu, 1996):
11963
11964 call reicalc(ncol,pcols,pver,tlay,reice)
11965
11966 if(iceflglw .eq. 3) then
11967 do k = kts, kte
11968 reice(ncol,k) = reice(ncol,k) * 1.0315
11969 reice(ncol,k) = min(140.0,reice(ncol,k))
11970 enddo
11971 endif
11972 endif
11973
11974 if(has_reqs .ne. 0) then
11975 !--- fill the effective radius for snow with that calculated in the Thompson cloud
11976 ! microphysics parameterization:
11977 inflglw = 5
11978 iceflglw = 5
11979 do k = kts, kte
11980 resnow(ncol,k) = max(10.,re_snow(i,k,j)*1.e6)
11981 enddo
11982 else
11983 do k = kts, kte
11984 resnow(ncol,k) = 10.
11985 enddo
11986 endif
11987
11988 !--- calculate the cloud liquid water path in units of g/m2 below the model top:
11989 do k = kts, kte
11990 gliqwp = qc1d(k) * pdel(ncol,k)*100.0 / gravmks * 1000.0 !grid box liquid water path.
11991 cliqwp(ncol,k) = gliqwp / max(0.01,cldfrac(ncol,k)) !in-cloud liquid water path.
11992 enddo
11993
11994 !--- calculate the cloud ice path in units of g/m2 below the model top:
11995 if(iceflglw .eq. 3)then
11996 do k = kts, kte
11997 gicewp = (qi1d(k)+qs1d(k)) * pdel(ncol,k)*100.0 / gravmks * 1000.0 !grid box ice water path.
11998 cicewp(ncol,k) = gicewp / max(0.01,cldfrac(ncol,k)) !in-cloud ice water path.
11999 enddo
12000 elseif(iceflglw .ge. 4) then
12001 do k = kts, kte
12002 gicewp = qi1d(k) * pdel(ncol,k)*100.0 / gravmks * 1000.0 !grid box ice water path.
12003 cicewp(ncol,k) = gicewp / max(0.01,cldfrac(ncol,k)) !in-cloud ice water path.
12004 enddo
12005 endif
12006
12007 !--- calculate the snow path in units of g/m2 below the model top:
12008 if(iceflglw.eq.5)then
12009 do k = kts, kte
12010 snow_mass_factor = 1.0
12011 if(resnow(ncol,k) .gt. 130.)then
12012 snow_mass_factor = (130.0/resnow(ncol,k))*(130.0/resnow(ncol,k))
12013 resnow(ncol,k) = 130.0
12014 endif
12015 gsnowp = qs1d(k) * pdel(ncol,k)*100.0 / gravmks * 1000.0 ! grid box snow path.
12016 csnowp(ncol,k) = snow_mass_factor * gsnowp / max(0.01,cldfrac(ncol,k))
12017 enddo
12018 endif
12019
12020 !--- set the cloud physical property between the model top and the top of the atmosphere. do not allow
12021 ! clouds between the model top and the top of the atmosphere:
12022 do k = kts, kte
12023 clwpth(ncol,k) = cliqwp(ncol,k)
12024 ciwpth(ncol,k) = cicewp(ncol,k)
12025 cswpth(ncol,k) = csnowp(ncol,k)
12026 rel(ncol,k) = reliq(ncol,k)
12027 rei(ncol,k) = reice(ncol,k)
12028 res(ncol,k) = resnow(ncol,k)
12029 enddo
12030 do k = kte+1, nlayers
12031 clwpth(ncol,k) = 0.
12032 ciwpth(ncol,k) = 0.
12033 cswpth(ncol,k) = 0.
12034 rel(ncol,k) = 10.
12035 rei(ncol,k) = 10.
12036 res(ncol,k) = 10.
12037 cldfrac(ncol,k) = 0.
12038 do nb = 1, nbndlw
12039 taucld(nb,ncol,k) = 0.
12040 enddo
12041 enddo
12042
12043 endif
12044
12045 !--- sub-column generator for McICA:
12046 iplon = 1
12047 irng = 0
12048 permuteseed = 150
12049
12050 call mcica_subcol_lw &
12051 (iplon , ncol , nlay , icld , permuteseed , irng , play , &
12052 cldfrac , ciwpth , clwpth , cswpth , rei , rel , res , &
12053 taucld , cldfmcl , ciwpmcl , clwpmcl , cswpmcl , reicmcl , relqmcl , &
12054 resnmcl , taucmcl)
12055
12056 !--- initialization of aerosol optical depths:
12057 do nb = 1, nbndlw
12058 do k = kts, nlayers
12059 tauaer(ncol,k,nb) = 0.
12060 enddo
12061 enddo
12062
12063
12064
12065 !--- CALL TO THE RRTMG LONG WAVE RADIATION MODEL:
12066 call rrtmg_lw &
12067 (ncol , nlay , icld , play , plev , tlay , &
12068 tlev , tsfc , h2ovmr , o3vmr , co2vmr , ch4vmr , &
12069 n2ovmr , o2vmr , cfc11vmr , cfc12vmr , cfc22vmr , ccl4vmr , &
12070 emis , inflglw , iceflglw , liqflglw , cldfmcl , taucmcl , &
12071 ciwpmcl , clwpmcl , cswpmcl , reicmcl , relqmcl , resnmcl , &
12072 tauaer , uflx , dflx , hr , uflxc , dflxc , &
12073 hrc)
12074
12075
12076
12077 !--- OUTPUTS:
12078 glw(i,j) = dflx(1,1)
12079 olr(i,j) = uflx(1,nlayers+1)
12080 lwcf(i,j) = uflxc(1,nlayers+1) - uflx(1,nlayers+1)
12081
12082 if(present(lwupt)) then
12083 !output up and down toa fluxes for total and clear sky:
12084 lwupt(i,j) = uflx(1,nlayers+1)
12085 lwuptc(i,j) = uflxc(1,nlayers+1)
12086 lwdnt(i,j) = dflx(1,nlayers+1)
12087 lwdntc(i,j) = dflxc(1,nlayers+1)
12088 !output up and down surface fluxes for total and clear sky:
12089 lwupb(i,j) = uflx(1,1)
12090 lwupbc(i,j) = uflxc(1,1)
12091 lwdnb(i,j) = dflx(1,1)
12092 lwdnbc(i,j) = dflxc(1,1)
12093 endif
12094
12095 if(present(lwupflx)) then
12096 !output up and down fluxes:
12097 do k=kts,nlayers+1
12098 lwupflx(i,k,j) = uflx(1,k)
12099 lwupflxc(i,k,j) = uflxc(1,k)
12100 lwdnflx(i,k,j) = dflx(1,k)
12101 lwdnflxc(i,k,j) = dflxc(1,k)
12102 enddo
12103 endif
12104
12105 !--- output heating rate tendency. convert heating rate from K per day to K per second:
12106 do k = kts, kte
12107 tten1d(k) = hr(ncol,k)/86400.
12108 rthratenlw(i,k,j) = tten1d(k)/pi3d(i,k,j)
12109 enddo
12110
12111 !--- output the effective radii for cloud water, cloud ice, and snow:
12112 if(icloud.gt.0 .and. present(rre_cloud) .and. present(rre_ice) .and. present(rre_snow)) then
12113 do k = kts, kte
12114 if(cldfra3d(i,k,j) .gt. 0.) then
12115 rre_cloud(i,k,j) = rel(ncol,k)
12116 rre_ice(i,k,j) = rei(ncol,k)
12117 rre_snow(i,k,j) = res(ncol,k)
12118 endif
12119 enddo
12120 endif
12121
12122 !--- deallocate local column arrays:
12123 if(allocated(o3mmr) ) deallocate(o3mmr )
12124 if(allocated(varint) ) deallocate(varint )
12125 if(allocated(plev) ) deallocate(plev )
12126 if(allocated(tlev) ) deallocate(tlev )
12127 if(allocated(play) ) deallocate(play )
12128 if(allocated(tlay) ) deallocate(tlay )
12129 if(allocated(h2ovmr) ) deallocate(h2ovmr )
12130 if(allocated(o3vmr) ) deallocate(o3vmr )
12131 if(allocated(co2vmr) ) deallocate(co2vmr )
12132 if(allocated(o2vmr) ) deallocate(o2vmr )
12133 if(allocated(ch4vmr) ) deallocate(ch4vmr )
12134 if(allocated(n2ovmr) ) deallocate(n2ovmr )
12135 if(allocated(cfc11vmr)) deallocate(cfc11vmr)
12136 if(allocated(cfc12vmr)) deallocate(cfc12vmr)
12137 if(allocated(cfc22vmr)) deallocate(cfc22vmr)
12138 if(allocated(ccl4vmr) ) deallocate(ccl4vmr )
12139 if(allocated(clwpth) ) deallocate(clwpth )
12140 if(allocated(ciwpth) ) deallocate(ciwpth )
12141 if(allocated(cswpth) ) deallocate(cswpth )
12142 if(allocated(rel) ) deallocate(rel )
12143 if(allocated(rei) ) deallocate(rei )
12144 if(allocated(res) ) deallocate(res )
12145 if(allocated(cldfrac) ) deallocate(cldfrac )
12146 if(allocated(relqmcl) ) deallocate(relqmcl )
12147 if(allocated(reicmcl) ) deallocate(reicmcl )
12148 if(allocated(resnmcl) ) deallocate(resnmcl )
12149 if(allocated(uflx) ) deallocate(uflx )
12150 if(allocated(dflx) ) deallocate(dflx )
12151 if(allocated(uflxc) ) deallocate(uflxc )
12152 if(allocated(dflxc) ) deallocate(dflxc )
12153 if(allocated(hr) ) deallocate(hr )
12154 if(allocated(hrc) ) deallocate(hrc )
12155 if(allocated(taucld) ) deallocate(taucld )
12156 if(allocated(cldfmcl) ) deallocate(cldfmcl )
12157 if(allocated(clwpmcl) ) deallocate(clwpmcl )
12158 if(allocated(ciwpmcl) ) deallocate(ciwpmcl )
12159 if(allocated(cswpmcl) ) deallocate(cswpmcl )
12160 if(allocated(taucmcl) ) deallocate(taucmcl )
12161 if(allocated(tauaer) ) deallocate(tauaer )
12162
12163 end do i_loop !end longitude loop.
12164
12165 end do j_loop !end latitude loop.
12166
12167 end subroutine rrtmg_lwrad
12168
12169!=================================================================================================================
12170 SUBROUTINE inirad (O3PROF,Plev, kts, kte)
12171!-------------------------------------------------------------------------
12172 IMPLICIT NONE
12173!-------------------------------------------------------------------------
12174 INTEGER, INTENT(IN ) :: kts,kte
12175
12176 REAL, DIMENSION( kts:kte+1 ),INTENT(INOUT) :: O3PROF
12177
12178 REAL, DIMENSION( kts:kte+2 ),INTENT(IN ) :: Plev
12179
12180! LOCAL VAR
12181
12182 INTEGER :: k
12183
12184!
12185! COMPUTE OZONE MIXING RATIO DISTRIBUTION
12186!
12187 DO k=kts,kte+1
12188 o3prof(k)=0.
12189 ENDDO
12190
12191 CALL o3data(o3prof, plev, kts, kte)
12192
12193 END SUBROUTINE inirad
12194
12195!-------------------------------------------------------------------------
12196 SUBROUTINE o3data (O3PROF, Plev, kts, kte)
12197!-------------------------------------------------------------------------
12198 IMPLICIT NONE
12199!-------------------------------------------------------------------------
12200!
12201 INTEGER, INTENT(IN ) :: kts, kte
12202!
12203 REAL, DIMENSION( kts:kte+1 ),INTENT(INOUT) :: O3PROF
12204
12205 REAL, DIMENSION( kts:kte+2 ),INTENT(IN ) :: Plev
12206
12207! LOCAL VAR
12208 INTEGER :: K, JJ
12209
12210 REAL :: PRLEVH(kts:kte+2),PPWRKH(32), &
12211 o3wrk(31),ppwrk(31),o3sum(31),ppsum(31), &
12212 o3win(31),ppwin(31),o3ann(31),ppann(31)
12213
12214 REAL :: PB1, PB2, PT1, PT2
12215
12216 DATA o3sum /5.297e-8,5.852e-8,6.579e-8,7.505e-8, &
12217 8.577e-8,9.895e-8,1.175e-7,1.399e-7,1.677e-7,2.003e-7, &
12218 2.571e-7,3.325e-7,4.438e-7,6.255e-7,8.168e-7,1.036e-6, &
12219 1.366e-6,1.855e-6,2.514e-6,3.240e-6,4.033e-6,4.854e-6, &
12220 5.517e-6,6.089e-6,6.689e-6,1.106e-5,1.462e-5,1.321e-5, &
12221 9.856e-6,5.960e-6,5.960e-6/
12222
12223 DATA ppsum /955.890,850.532,754.599,667.742,589.841, &
12224 519.421,455.480,398.085,347.171,301.735,261.310,225.360, &
12225 193.419,165.490,141.032,120.125,102.689, 87.829, 75.123, &
12226 64.306, 55.086, 47.209, 40.535, 34.795, 29.865, 19.122, &
12227 9.277, 4.660, 2.421, 1.294, 0.647/
12228!
12229 DATA o3win /4.629e-8,4.686e-8,5.017e-8,5.613e-8, &
12230 6.871e-8,8.751e-8,1.138e-7,1.516e-7,2.161e-7,3.264e-7, &
12231 4.968e-7,7.338e-7,1.017e-6,1.308e-6,1.625e-6,2.011e-6, &
12232 2.516e-6,3.130e-6,3.840e-6,4.703e-6,5.486e-6,6.289e-6, &
12233 6.993e-6,7.494e-6,8.197e-6,9.632e-6,1.113e-5,1.146e-5, &
12234 9.389e-6,6.135e-6,6.135e-6/
12235
12236 DATA ppwin /955.747,841.783,740.199,649.538,568.404, &
12237 495.815,431.069,373.464,322.354,277.190,237.635,203.433, &
12238 174.070,148.949,127.408,108.915, 93.114, 79.551, 67.940, &
12239 58.072, 49.593, 42.318, 36.138, 30.907, 26.362, 16.423, &
12240 7.583, 3.620, 1.807, 0.938, 0.469/
12241!
12242
12243 DO k=1,31
12244 ppann(k)=ppsum(k)
12245 ENDDO
12246!
12247 o3ann(1)=0.5*(o3sum(1)+o3win(1))
12248!
12249 DO k=2,31
12250 o3ann(k)=o3win(k-1)+(o3win(k)-o3win(k-1))/(ppwin(k)-ppwin(k-1))* &
12251 (ppsum(k)-ppwin(k-1))
12252 ENDDO
12253!
12254 DO k=2,31
12255 o3ann(k)=0.5*(o3ann(k)+o3sum(k))
12256 ENDDO
12257!
12258 DO k=1,31
12259 o3wrk(k)=o3ann(k)
12260 ppwrk(k)=ppann(k)
12261 ENDDO
12262!
12263! CALCULATE HALF PRESSURE LEVELS FOR MODEL AND DATA LEVELS
12264!
12265
12266! Plev is total P at model levels, from bottom to top
12267! Plev is in mb
12268
12269 DO k=kts,kte+2
12270 prlevh(k)=plev(k)
12271 ENDDO
12272!
12273 ppwrkh(1)=1100.
12274 DO k=2,31
12275 ppwrkh(k)=(ppwrk(k)+ppwrk(k-1))/2.
12276 ENDDO
12277 ppwrkh(32)=0.
12278 DO k=kts,kte+1
12279 DO 25 jj=1,31
12280 IF((-(prlevh(k)-ppwrkh(jj))).GE.0.)THEN
12281 pb1=0.
12282 ELSE
12283 pb1=prlevh(k)-ppwrkh(jj)
12284 ENDIF
12285 IF((-(prlevh(k)-ppwrkh(jj+1))).GE.0.)THEN
12286 pb2=0.
12287 ELSE
12288 pb2=prlevh(k)-ppwrkh(jj+1)
12289 ENDIF
12290 IF((-(prlevh(k+1)-ppwrkh(jj))).GE.0.)THEN
12291 pt1=0.
12292 ELSE
12293 pt1=prlevh(k+1)-ppwrkh(jj)
12294 ENDIF
12295 IF((-(prlevh(k+1)-ppwrkh(jj+1))).GE.0.)THEN
12296 pt2=0.
12297 ELSE
12298 pt2=prlevh(k+1)-ppwrkh(jj+1)
12299 ENDIF
12300 o3prof(k)=o3prof(k)+(pb2-pb1-pt2+pt1)*o3wrk(jj)
12301 25 CONTINUE
12302 o3prof(k)=o3prof(k)/(prlevh(k)-prlevh(k+1))
12303
12304 ENDDO
12305!
12306 END SUBROUTINE o3data
12307
12308!------------------------------------------------------------------
12309
12310!LDF (2013-03-15): This section of the module is moved to module_physics_rrtmg_lwinit.F in
12311!./../core_physics to accomodate differences in the mpi calls between WRF and MPAS.I thought
12312!that it would be cleaner to do this instead of adding a lot of #ifdef statements throughout
12313!the initialization of the longwave radiation code. Initialization is handled the same way
12314!for the shortwave radiation code.
12315
12316#if !defined(mpas)
12317
12318!====================================================================
12319 SUBROUTINE rrtmg_lwinit( &
12320 p_top, allowed_to_read , &
12321 ids, ide, jds, jde, kds, kde, &
12322 ims, ime, jms, jme, kms, kme, &
12323 its, ite, jts, jte, kts, kte )
12324!--------------------------------------------------------------------
12325 IMPLICIT NONE
12326!--------------------------------------------------------------------
12327
12328 LOGICAL , INTENT(IN) :: allowed_to_read
12329 INTEGER , INTENT(IN) :: ids, ide, jds, jde, kds, kde, &
12330 ims, ime, jms, jme, kms, kme, &
12331 its, ite, jts, jte, kts, kte
12332 REAL, INTENT(IN) :: p_top
12333
12334! Steven Cavallo. Added for buffer layer adjustment. December 2010.
12335 nlayers = kme + nint(p_top*0.01/deltap)- 1 ! Model levels plus new levels.
12336 ! nlayers will subsequently
12337 ! replace kte+1
12338
12339! Read in absorption coefficients and other data
12340 IF ( allowed_to_read ) THEN
12341 CALL rrtmg_lwlookuptable
12342 ENDIF
12343
12344! Perform g-point reduction and other initializations
12345! Specific heat of dry air (cp) used in flux to heating rate conversion factor.
12346 call rrtmg_lw_ini(cp)
12347
12348 END SUBROUTINE rrtmg_lwinit
12349
12350
12351! **************************************************************************
12352 SUBROUTINE rrtmg_lwlookuptable
12353! **************************************************************************
12354
12355IMPLICIT NONE
12356
12357! Local
12358 INTEGER :: i
12359 LOGICAL :: opened
12360 LOGICAL , EXTERNAL :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
12361
12362 CHARACTER*80 errmess
12363 INTEGER rrtmg_unit
12364
12365 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) THEN
12366 DO i = 10,99
12367 inquire ( i , opened = opened )
12368 IF ( .NOT. opened ) THEN
12369 rrtmg_unit = i
12370 GOTO 2010
12371 ENDIF
12372 ENDDO
12373 rrtmg_unit = -1
12374 2010 CONTINUE
12375 ENDIF
12376 CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( rrtmg_unit , iwordsize )
12377 IF ( rrtmg_unit < 0 ) THEN
12378 CALL wrf_error_fatal ( 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: rrtm_lwlookuptable: Can not '// &
12379 'find unused fortran unit to read in lookup table.' )
12380 ENDIF
12381
12382 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) THEN
12383 OPEN(rrtmg_unit,file='RRTMG_LW_DATA', &
12384 form='UNFORMATTED',status='OLD',err=9009)
12385 ENDIF
12386
12387 call lw_kgb01(rrtmg_unit)
12388 call lw_kgb02(rrtmg_unit)
12389 call lw_kgb03(rrtmg_unit)
12390 call lw_kgb04(rrtmg_unit)
12391 call lw_kgb05(rrtmg_unit)
12392 call lw_kgb06(rrtmg_unit)
12393 call lw_kgb07(rrtmg_unit)
12394 call lw_kgb08(rrtmg_unit)
12395 call lw_kgb09(rrtmg_unit)
12396 call lw_kgb10(rrtmg_unit)
12397 call lw_kgb11(rrtmg_unit)
12398 call lw_kgb12(rrtmg_unit)
12399 call lw_kgb13(rrtmg_unit)
12400 call lw_kgb14(rrtmg_unit)
12401 call lw_kgb15(rrtmg_unit)
12402 call lw_kgb16(rrtmg_unit)
12403
12404 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) CLOSE (rrtmg_unit)
12405
12406 RETURN
124079009 CONTINUE
12408 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error opening RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
12409 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
12410
12411 END SUBROUTINE rrtmg_lwlookuptable
12412
12413! **************************************************************************
12414! RRTMG Longwave Radiative Transfer Model
12415! Atmospheric and Environmental Research, Inc., Cambridge, MA
12416!
12417! Original version: E. J. Mlawer, et al.
12418! Revision for GCMs: Michael J. Iacono; October, 2002
12419! Revision for F90 formatting: Michael J. Iacono; June 2006
12420!
12421! This file contains 16 READ statements that include the
12422! absorption coefficients and other data for each of the 16 longwave
12423! spectral bands used in RRTMG_LW. Here, the data are defined for 16
12424! g-points, or sub-intervals, per band. These data are combined and
12425! weighted using a mapping procedure in module RRTMG_LW_INIT to reduce
12426! the total number of g-points from 256 to 140 for use in the GCM.
12427! **************************************************************************
12428
12429! **************************************************************************
12430 subroutine lw_kgb01(rrtmg_unit)
12431! **************************************************************************
12432
12433 use rrlw_kg01, only : fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, kao_mn2, kbo_mn2, &
12434 absa, absb, &
12435 selfrefo, forrefo
12436
12437 implicit none
12438 save
12439
12440! Input
12441 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
12442
12443! Local
12444 character*80 errmess
12445 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
12446
12447! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
12448! and upper atmosphere.
12449! Planck fraction mapping levels: P = 212.7250 mbar, T = 223.06 K
12450
12451! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
12452! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb and temperatures. The first
12453! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
12454! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
12455! data are for the corresponding TREF for this pressure level,
12456! JT = 2 refers to the temperatureTREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30,
12457! JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30. The second
12458! index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers to the corresponding
12459! pressure level in PREF (e.g. JP = 1 is for a pressure of 1053.63 mb).
12460! The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and tells us which
12461! g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
12462
12463! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
12464! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
12465! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
12466! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
12467! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
12468! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
12469! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
12470! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
12471! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
12472! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
12473! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
12474
12475! The arrays kao_mn2 and kbo_mn2 contain the coefficients of the
12476! nitrogen continuum for the upper and lower atmosphere.
12477! Minor gas mapping levels:
12478! Lower - n2: P = 142.5490 mbar, T = 215.70 K
12479! Upper - n2: P = 142.5490 mbar, T = 215.70 K
12480
12481! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
12482! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
12483! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
12484! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
12485! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12486
12487! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
12488! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
12489! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
12490! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
12491! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12492
12493#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
12494
12495 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
12496 fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, kao_mn2, kbo_mn2, selfrefo, forrefo
12497 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
12498 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefbo)
12499 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
12500 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
12501 dm_bcast_macro(kao_mn2)
12502 dm_bcast_macro(kbo_mn2)
12503 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
12504 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
12505
12506 RETURN
125079010 CONTINUE
12508 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
12509 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
12510
12511 end subroutine lw_kgb01
12512
12513! **************************************************************************
12514 subroutine lw_kgb02(rrtmg_unit)
12515! **************************************************************************
12516
12517 use rrlw_kg02, only : fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo
12518
12519 implicit none
12520 save
12521
12522! Input
12523 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
12524
12525! Local
12526 character*80 errmess
12527 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
12528
12529! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
12530! and upper atmosphere.
12531! Planck fraction mapping levels:
12532! Lower: P = 1053.630 mbar, T = 294.2 K
12533! Upper: P = 3.206e-2 mb, T = 197.92 K
12534
12535! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
12536! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb and temperatures. The first
12537! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
12538! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
12539! data are for the corresponding TREF for this pressure level,
12540! JT = 2 refers to the temperatureTREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30,
12541! JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30. The second
12542! index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers to the corresponding
12543! pressure level in PREF (e.g. JP = 1 is for a pressure of 1053.63 mb).
12544! The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and tells us which
12545! g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
12546
12547! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
12548! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
12549! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
12550! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
12551! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
12552! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
12553! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
12554! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
12555! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
12556! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
12557! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
12558
12559! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
12560! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
12561! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
12562! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
12563! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12564
12565! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
12566! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
12567! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
12568! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
12569! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12570
12571#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
12572
12573 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
12574 fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo
12575 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
12576 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefbo)
12577 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
12578 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
12579 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
12580 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
12581
12582 RETURN
125839010 CONTINUE
12584 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
12585 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
12586
12587 end subroutine lw_kgb02
12588
12589! **************************************************************************
12590 subroutine lw_kgb03(rrtmg_unit)
12591! **************************************************************************
12592
12593 use rrlw_kg03, only : fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, kao_mn2o, &
12594 kbo_mn2o, selfrefo, forrefo
12595
12596 implicit none
12597 save
12598
12599! Input
12600 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
12601
12602! Local
12603 character*80 errmess
12604 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
12605
12606! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
12607! and upper atmosphere.
12608! Planck fraction mapping levels:
12609! Lower: P = 212.7250 mbar, T = 223.06 K
12610! Upper: P = 95.8 mbar, T = 215.7 k
12611
12612! The array KAO contains absorption coefs for each of the 16 g-intervals
12613! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb, temperatures, and ratios
12614! of water vapor to CO2. The first index in the array, JS, runs
12615! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
12616! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
12617! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
12618! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
12619! to that of gas2.
12620! The 2nd index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds
12621! to different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
12622! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
12623! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature
12624! TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
12625! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
12626! to the reference pressure level (e.g. JP = 1 is for a
12627! pressure of 1053.63 mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
12628! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
12629
12630! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
12631! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
12632! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
12633! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
12634! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
12635! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
12636! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
12637! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
12638! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
12639! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
12640! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
12641! The 2nd index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds
12642! to different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
12643! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
12644! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature
12645! TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
12646! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
12647! to the reference pressure level (e.g. JP = 1 is for a
12648! pressure of 1053.63 mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
12649! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
12650
12651! The array KAO_Mxx contains the absorption coefficient for
12652! a minor species at the 16 chosen g-values for a reference pressure
12653! level below 100~ mb. The first index in the array, JS, runs
12654! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
12655! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
12656! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
12657! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
12658! to that of gas2. The second index refers to temperature
12659! in 7.2 degree increments. For instance, JT = 1 refers to a
12660! temperature of 188.0, JT = 2 refers to 195.2, etc. The third index
12661! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12662
12663! The array KBO_Mxx contains the absorption coefficient for
12664! a minor species at the 16 chosen g-values for a reference pressure
12665! level above 100~ mb. The first index in the array, JS, runs
12666! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amounts ratios,
12667! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
12668! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
12669! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1 to
12670! that of gas2. The second index refers to temperature
12671! in 7.2 degree increments. For instance, JT = 1 refers to a
12672! temperature of 188.0, JT = 2 refers to 195.2, etc. The third index
12673! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12674
12675! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
12676! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
12677! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
12678! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
12679! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12680
12681! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
12682! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
12683! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
12684! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
12685! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12686
12687#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
12688
12689 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
12690 fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, kao_mn2o, kbo_mn2o, selfrefo, forrefo
12691 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
12692 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefbo)
12693 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
12694 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
12695 dm_bcast_macro(kao_mn2o)
12696 dm_bcast_macro(kbo_mn2o)
12697 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
12698 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
12699
12700 RETURN
127019010 CONTINUE
12702 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
12703 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
12704
12705 end subroutine lw_kgb03
12706
12707! **************************************************************************
12708 subroutine lw_kgb04(rrtmg_unit)
12709! **************************************************************************
12710
12711 use rrlw_kg04, only : fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo
12712
12713 implicit none
12714 save
12715
12716! Input
12717 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
12718
12719! Local
12720 character*80 errmess
12721 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
12722
12723! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
12724! and upper atmosphere.
12725! Planck fraction mapping levels:
12726! Lower : P = 142.5940 mbar, T = 215.70 K
12727! Upper : P = 95.58350 mb, T = 215.70 K
12728
12729! The array KAO contains absorption coefs for each of the 16 g-intervals
12730! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb, temperatures, and ratios
12731! of water vapor to CO2. The first index in the array, JS, runs
12732! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
12733! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
12734! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
12735! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
12736! to that of gas2.
12737! The 2nd index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds
12738! to different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
12739! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
12740! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature
12741! TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
12742! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
12743! to the reference pressure level (e.g. JP = 1 is for a
12744! pressure of 1053.63 mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
12745! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
12746
12747! The array KBO contains absorption coefs for each of the 16 g-intervals
12748! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb, temperatures, and ratios
12749! of H2O to CO2. The first index in the array, JS, runs
12750! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
12751! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
12752! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
12753! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
12754! to that of gas2. The second index, JT, which
12755! runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to different temperatures. More
12756! specifically, JT = 3 means that the data are for the corresponding
12757! reference temperature TREF for this pressure level, JT = 2 refers
12758! to the TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and
12759! JT = 5 is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and
12760! refers to the corresponding pressure level in PREF (e.g. JP = 13 is
12761! for a pressure of 95.5835 mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to
12762! 16, and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
12763
12764! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
12765! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
12766! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
12767! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
12768! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12769
12770! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
12771! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
12772! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
12773! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
12774! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12775
12776#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
12777
12778 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
12779 fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo
12780 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
12781 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefbo)
12782 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
12783 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
12784 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
12785 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
12786
12787 RETURN
127889010 CONTINUE
12789 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
12790 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
12791
12792 end subroutine lw_kgb04
12793
12794! **************************************************************************
12795 subroutine lw_kgb05(rrtmg_unit)
12796! **************************************************************************
12797
12798 use rrlw_kg05, only : fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, kao_mo3, &
12799 selfrefo, forrefo, ccl4o
12800
12801 implicit none
12802 save
12803
12804! Input
12805 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
12806
12807! Local
12808 character*80 errmess
12809 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
12810
12811! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
12812! and upper atmosphere.
12813! Planck fraction mapping levels:
12814! Lower: P = 473.42 mb, T = 259.83
12815! Upper: P = 0.2369280 mbar, T = 253.60 K
12816
12817! The arrays kao_mo3 and ccl4o contain the coefficients for
12818! ozone and ccl4 in the lower atmosphere.
12819! Minor gas mapping level:
12820! Lower - o3: P = 317.34 mbar, T = 240.77 k
12821! Lower - ccl4:
12822
12823! The array KAO contains absorption coefs for each of the 16 g-intervals
12824! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb, temperatures, and ratios
12825! of water vapor to CO2. The first index in the array, JS, runs
12826! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
12827! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
12828! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
12829! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
12830! to that of gas2.
12831! The 2nd index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds
12832! to different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
12833! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
12834! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature
12835! TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
12836! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
12837! to the reference pressure level (e.g. JP = 1 is for a
12838! pressure of 1053.63 mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
12839! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
12840
12841! The array KBO contains absorption coefs for each of the 16 g-intervals
12842! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb, temperatures, and ratios
12843! of H2O to CO2. The first index in the array, JS, runs
12844! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
12845! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
12846! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
12847! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
12848! to that of gas2. The second index, JT, which
12849! runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to different temperatures. More
12850! specifically, JT = 3 means that the data are for the corresponding
12851! reference temperature TREF for this pressure level, JT = 2 refers
12852! to the TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and
12853! JT = 5 is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and
12854! refers to the corresponding pressure level in PREF (e.g. JP = 13 is
12855! for a pressure of 95.5835 mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to
12856! 16, and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
12857
12858! The array KAO_Mxx contains the absorption coefficient for
12859! a minor species at the 16 chosen g-values for a reference pressure
12860! level below 100~ mb. The first index in the array, JS, runs
12861! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
12862! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
12863! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
12864! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
12865! to that of gas2. The second index refers to temperature
12866! in 7.2 degree increments. For instance, JT = 1 refers to a
12867! temperature of 188.0, JT = 2 refers to 195.2, etc. The third index
12868! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12869
12870! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
12871! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
12872! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
12873! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
12874! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12875
12876! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
12877! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
12878! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
12879! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
12880! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12881
12882#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
12883
12884 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
12885 fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, kao_mo3, ccl4o, selfrefo, forrefo
12886 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
12887 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefbo)
12888 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
12889 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
12890 dm_bcast_macro(kao_mo3)
12891 dm_bcast_macro(ccl4o)
12892 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
12893 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
12894
12895 RETURN
128969010 CONTINUE
12897 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
12898 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
12899
12900 end subroutine lw_kgb05
12901
12902! **************************************************************************
12903 subroutine lw_kgb06(rrtmg_unit)
12904! **************************************************************************
12905
12906 use rrlw_kg06, only : fracrefao, kao, kao_mco2, selfrefo, forrefo, &
12907 cfc11adjo, cfc12o
12908
12909 implicit none
12910 save
12911
12912! Input
12913 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
12914
12915! Local
12916 character*80 errmess
12917 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
12918
12919! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
12920! and upper atmosphere.
12921! Planck fraction mapping levels:
12922! Lower: : P = 473.4280 mb, T = 259.83 K
12923
12924! The arrays kao_mco2, cfc11adjo and cfc12o contain the coefficients for
12925! carbon dioxide in the lower atmosphere and cfc11 and cfc12 in the upper
12926! atmosphere.
12927! Original cfc11 is multiplied by 1.385 to account for the 1060-1107 cm-1 band.
12928! Minor gas mapping level:
12929! Lower - co2: P = 706.2720 mb, T = 294.2 k
12930! Upper - cfc11, cfc12
12931
12932! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
12933! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb and temperatures. The first
12934! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
12935! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
12936! data are for the corresponding TREF for this pressure level,
12937! JT = 2 refers to the temperatureTREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30,
12938! JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30. The second
12939! index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers to the corresponding
12940! pressure level in PREF (e.g. JP = 1 is for a pressure of 1053.63 mb).
12941! The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and tells us which
12942! g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
12943
12944! The array KAO_Mxx contains the absorption coefficient for
12945! a minor species at the 16 chosen g-values for a reference pressure
12946! level below 100~ mb. The first index refers to temperature
12947! in 7.2 degree increments. For instance, JT = 1 refers to a
12948! temperature of 188.0, JT = 2 refers to 195.2, etc. The second index
12949! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12950
12951! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
12952! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
12953! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
12954! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
12955! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12956
12957! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
12958! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
12959! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
12960! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
12961! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
12962
12963#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
12964
12965 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
12966 fracrefao, kao, kao_mco2, cfc11adjo, cfc12o, selfrefo, forrefo
12967 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
12968 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
12969 dm_bcast_macro(kao_mco2)
12970 dm_bcast_macro(cfc11adjo)
12971 dm_bcast_macro(cfc12o)
12972 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
12973 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
12974
12975 RETURN
129769010 CONTINUE
12977 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
12978 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
12979
12980 end subroutine lw_kgb06
12981
12982! **************************************************************************
12983 subroutine lw_kgb07(rrtmg_unit)
12984! **************************************************************************
12985
12986 use rrlw_kg07, only : fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, kao_mco2, &
12987 kbo_mco2, selfrefo, forrefo
12988
12989 implicit none
12990 save
12991
12992! Input
12993 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
12994
12995! Local
12996 character*80 errmess
12997 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
12998
12999! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
13000! and upper atmosphere.
13001! Planck fraction mapping levels:
13002! Lower : P = 706.27 mb, T = 278.94 K
13003! Upper : P = 95.58 mbar, T= 215.70 K
13004
13005! The array KAO contains absorption coefs for each of the 16 g-intervals
13006! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb, temperatures, and ratios
13007! of water vapor to CO2. The first index in the array, JS, runs
13008! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
13009! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
13010! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
13011! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
13012! to that of gas2.
13013! The 2nd index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds
13014! to different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13015! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
13016! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature
13017! TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
13018! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
13019! to the reference pressure level (e.g. JP = 1 is for a
13020! pressure of 1053.63 mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
13021! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13022
13023! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
13024! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
13025! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
13026! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13027! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
13028! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
13029! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
13030! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
13031! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
13032! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
13033! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13034
13035! The array KAO_Mxx contains the absorption coefficient for
13036! a minor species at the 16 chosen g-values for a reference pressure
13037! level below 100~ mb. The first index in the array, JS, runs
13038! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
13039! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
13040! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
13041! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
13042! to that of gas2. The second index refers to temperature
13043! in 7.2 degree increments. For instance, JT = 1 refers to a
13044! temperature of 188.0, JT = 2 refers to 195.2, etc. The third index
13045! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13046
13047! The array KBO_Mxx contains the absorption coefficient for
13048! a minor species at the 16 chosen g-values for a reference pressure
13049! level above 100~ mb. The first index refers to temperature
13050! in 7.2 degree increments. For instance, JT = 1 refers to a
13051! temperature of 188.0, JT = 2 refers to 195.2, etc. The second index
13052! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13053
13054! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13055! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
13056! index refers to reference temperature (296_rb,260_rb,224,260) and
13057! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
13058! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13059
13060! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13061! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
13062! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
13063! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
13064! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13065
13066#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
13067
13068 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
13069 fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, kao_mco2, kbo_mco2, selfrefo, forrefo
13070 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
13071 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefbo)
13072 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
13073 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
13074 dm_bcast_macro(kao_mco2)
13075 dm_bcast_macro(kbo_mco2)
13076 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
13077 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
13078
13079 RETURN
130809010 CONTINUE
13081 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
13082 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
13083
13084 end subroutine lw_kgb07
13085
13086! **************************************************************************
13087 subroutine lw_kgb08(rrtmg_unit)
13088! **************************************************************************
13089
13090 use rrlw_kg08, only : fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kao_mco2, kao_mn2o, &
13091 kao_mo3, kbo, kbo_mco2, kbo_mn2o, selfrefo, forrefo, &
13092 cfc12o, cfc22adjo
13093
13094 implicit none
13095 save
13096
13097! Input
13098 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
13099
13100! Local
13101 character*80 errmess
13102 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
13103
13104! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
13105! and upper atmosphere.
13106! Planck fraction mapping levels:
13107! Lower: P=473.4280 mb, T = 259.83 K
13108! Upper: P=95.5835 mb, T= 215.7 K
13109
13110! The arrays kao_mco2, kbo_mco2, kao_mn2o, kbo_mn2o contain the coefficients for
13111! carbon dioxide and n2o in the lower and upper atmosphere.
13112! The array kao_mo3 contains the coefficients for ozone in the lower atmosphere,
13113! and arrays cfc12o and cfc12adjo contain the coefficients for cfc12 and cfc22.
13114! Original cfc22 is multiplied by 1.485 to account for the 780-850 cm-1
13115! and 1290-1335 cm-1 bands.
13116! Minor gas mapping level:
13117! Lower - co2: P = 1053.63 mb, T = 294.2 k
13118! Lower - o3: P = 317.348 mb, T = 240.77 k
13119! Lower - n2o: P = 706.2720 mb, T= 278.94 k
13120! Lower - cfc12, cfc22
13121! Upper - co2: P = 35.1632 mb, T = 223.28 k
13122! Upper - n2o: P = 8.716e-2 mb, T = 226.03 k
13123
13124! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
13125! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb and temperatures. The first
13126! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
13127! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13128! data are for the corresponding TREF for this pressure level,
13129! JT = 2 refers to the temperatureTREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30,
13130! JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30. The second
13131! index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers to the corresponding
13132! pressure level in PREF (e.g. JP = 1 is for a pressure of 1053.63 mb).
13133! The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and tells us which
13134! g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13135
13136! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
13137! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
13138! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
13139! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13140! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
13141! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
13142! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
13143! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
13144! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
13145! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
13146! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13147
13148! The array KAO_Mxx contains the absorption coefficient for
13149! a minor species at the 16 chosen g-values for a reference pressure
13150! level below 100~ mb. The first index refers to temperature
