13151! in 7.2 degree increments. For instance, JT = 1 refers to a
13152! temperature of 188.0, JT = 2 refers to 195.2, etc. The second index
13153! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13154
13155! The array KBO_Mxx contains the absorption coefficient for
13156! a minor species at the 16 chosen g-values for a reference pressure
13157! level above 100~ mb. The first index refers to temperature
13158! in 7.2 degree increments. For instance, JT = 1 refers to a
13159! temperature of 188.0, JT = 2 refers to 195.2, etc. The second index
13160! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13161
13162! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13163! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
13164! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
13165! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
13166! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13167
13168! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13169! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
13170! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
13171! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
13172! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13173
13174#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
13175
13176 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
13177 fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, kao_mco2, kbo_mco2, kao_mn2o, &
13178 kbo_mn2o, kao_mo3, cfc12o, cfc22adjo, selfrefo, forrefo
13179 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
13180 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefbo)
13181 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
13182 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
13183 dm_bcast_macro(kao_mco2)
13184 dm_bcast_macro(kbo_mco2)
13185 dm_bcast_macro(kao_mn2o)
13186 dm_bcast_macro(kbo_mn2o)
13187 dm_bcast_macro(kao_mo3)
13188 dm_bcast_macro(cfc12o)
13189 dm_bcast_macro(cfc22adjo)
13190 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
13191 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
13192
13193 RETURN
131949010 CONTINUE
13195 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
13196 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
13197
13198 end subroutine lw_kgb08
13199
13200! **************************************************************************
13201 subroutine lw_kgb09(rrtmg_unit)
13202! **************************************************************************
13203
13204 use rrlw_kg09, only : fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, kao_mn2o, &
13205 kbo_mn2o, selfrefo, forrefo
13206
13207 implicit none
13208 save
13209
13210! Input
13211 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
13212
13213! Local
13214 character*80 errmess
13215 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
13216
13217! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
13218! and upper atmosphere.
13219! Planck fraction mapping levels:
13220! Lower: P=212.7250 mb, T = 223.06 K
13221! Upper: P=3.20e-2 mb, T = 197.92 k
13222
13223! The array KAO contains absorption coefs for each of the 16 g-intervals
13224! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb, temperatures, and ratios
13225! of water vapor to CO2. The first index in the array, JS, runs
13226! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
13227! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
13228! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
13229! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
13230! to that of gas2.
13231! The 2nd index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds
13232! to different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13233! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
13234! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature
13235! TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
13236! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
13237! to the reference pressure level (e.g. JP = 1 is for a
13238! pressure of 1053.63 mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
13239! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13240
13241! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
13242! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
13243! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
13244! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13245! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
13246! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
13247! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
13248! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
13249! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
13250! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
13251! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13252
13253! The array KAO_Mxx contains the absorption coefficient for
13254! a minor species at the 16 chosen g-values for a reference pressure
13255! level below 100~ mb. The first index in the array, JS, runs
13256! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
13257! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
13258! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
13259! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
13260! to that of gas2. The second index refers to temperature
13261! in 7.2 degree increments. For instance, JT = 1 refers to a
13262! temperature of 188.0, JT = 2 refers to 195.2, etc. The third index
13263! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13264
13265! The array KBO_Mxx contains the absorption coefficient for
13266! a minor species at the 16 chosen g-values for a reference pressure
13267! level above 100~ mb. The first index refers to temperature
13268! in 7.2 degree increments. For instance, JT = 1 refers to a
13269! temperature of 188.0, JT = 2 refers to 195.2, etc. The second index
13270! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13271
13272! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13273! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
13274! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
13275! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
13276! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13277
13278! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13279! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
13280! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
13281! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
13282! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13283
13284#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
13285
13286 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
13287 fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, kao_mn2o, kbo_mn2o, selfrefo, forrefo
13288 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
13289 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefbo)
13290 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
13291 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
13292 dm_bcast_macro(kao_mn2o)
13293 dm_bcast_macro(kbo_mn2o)
13294 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
13295 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
13296
13297 RETURN
132989010 CONTINUE
13299 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
13300 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
13301
13302 end subroutine lw_kgb09
13303
13304! **************************************************************************
13305 subroutine lw_kgb10(rrtmg_unit)
13306! **************************************************************************
13307
13308 use rrlw_kg10, only : fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo
13309
13310 implicit none
13311 save
13312
13313! Input
13314 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
13315
13316! Local
13317 character*80 errmess
13318 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
13319
13320! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
13321! and upper atmosphere.
13322! Planck fraction mapping levels:
13323! Lower: P = 212.7250 mb, T = 223.06 K
13324! Upper: P = 95.58350 mb, T = 215.70 K
13325
13326! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
13327! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb and temperatures. The first
13328! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
13329! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13330! data are for the corresponding TREF for this pressure level,
13331! JT = 2 refers to the temperatureTREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30,
13332! JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30. The second
13333! index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers to the corresponding
13334! pressure level in PREF (e.g. JP = 1 is for a pressure of 1053.63 mb).
13335! The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and tells us which
13336! g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13337
13338! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
13339! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
13340! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
13341! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13342! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
13343! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
13344! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
13345! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
13346! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
13347! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
13348! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13349
13350! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13351! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
13352! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
13353! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
13354! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13355
13356! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13357! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
13358! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
13359! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
13360! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13361
13362#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
13363
13364 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
13365 fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo
13366 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
13367 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefbo)
13368 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
13369 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
13370 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
13371 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
13372
13373 RETURN
133749010 CONTINUE
13375 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
13376 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
13377
13378 end subroutine lw_kgb10
13379
13380! **************************************************************************
13381 subroutine lw_kgb11(rrtmg_unit)
13382! **************************************************************************
13383
13384 use rrlw_kg11, only : fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, kao_mo2, &
13385 kbo_mo2, selfrefo, forrefo
13386
13387 implicit none
13388 save
13389
13390! Input
13391 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
13392
13393! Local
13394 character*80 errmess
13395 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
13396
13397! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
13398! and upper atmosphere.
13399! Planck fraction mapping levels:
13400! Lower: P=1053.63 mb, T= 294.2 K
13401! Upper: P=0.353 mb, T = 262.11 K
13402
13403! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
13404! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb and temperatures. The first
13405! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
13406! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13407! data are for the corresponding TREF for this pressure level,
13408! JT = 2 refers to the temperatureTREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30,
13409! JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30. The second
13410! index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers to the corresponding
13411! pressure level in PREF (e.g. JP = 1 is for a pressure of 1053.63 mb).
13412! The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and tells us which
13413! g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13414
13415! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
13416! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
13417! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
13418! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13419! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
13420! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
13421! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
13422! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
13423! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
13424! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
13425! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13426
13427! The array KAO_Mxx contains the absorption coefficient for
13428! a minor species at the 16 chosen g-values for a reference pressure
13429! level below 100~ mb. The first index refers to temperature
13430! in 7.2 degree increments. For instance, JT = 1 refers to a
13431! temperature of 188.0, JT = 2 refers to 195.2, etc. The second index
13432! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13433
13434! The array KBO_Mxx contains the absorption coefficient for
13435! a minor species at the 16 chosen g-values for a reference pressure
13436! level above 100~ mb. The first index refers to temperature
13437! in 7.2 degree increments. For instance, JT = 1 refers to a
13438! temperature of 188.0, JT = 2 refers to 195.2, etc. The second index
13439! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13440
13441! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13442! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
13443! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
13444! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
13445! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13446
13447! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13448! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
13449! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
13450! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
13451! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13452
13453#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
13454
13455 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
13456 fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, kao_mo2, kbo_mo2, selfrefo, forrefo
13457 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
13458 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefbo)
13459 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
13460 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
13461 dm_bcast_macro(kao_mo2)
13462 dm_bcast_macro(kbo_mo2)
13463 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
13464 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
13465
13466 RETURN
134679010 CONTINUE
13468 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
13469 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
13470
13471 end subroutine lw_kgb11
13472
13473! **************************************************************************
13474 subroutine lw_kgb12(rrtmg_unit)
13475! **************************************************************************
13476
13477 use rrlw_kg12, only : fracrefao, kao, selfrefo, forrefo
13478
13479 implicit none
13480 save
13481
13482! Input
13483 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
13484
13485! Local
13486 character*80 errmess
13487 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
13488
13489! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
13490! and upper atmosphere.
13491! Planck fraction mapping levels:
13492! Lower: P = 174.1640 mbar, T= 215.78 K
13493
13494! The array KAO contains absorption coefs for each of the 16 g-intervals
13495! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb, temperatures, and ratios
13496! of water vapor to CO2. The first index in the array, JS, runs
13497! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
13498! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
13499! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
13500! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
13501! to that of gas2.
13502! The 2nd index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds
13503! to different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13504! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
13505! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature
13506! TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
13507! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
13508! to the reference pressure level (e.g. JP = 1 is for a
13509! pressure of 1053.63 mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
13510! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13511
13512! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13513! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
13514! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
13515! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
13516! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13517
13518! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13519! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
13520! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
13521! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
13522! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13523
13524#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
13525
13526 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
13527 fracrefao, kao, selfrefo, forrefo
13528 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
13529 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
13530 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
13531 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
13532
13533 RETURN
135349010 CONTINUE
13535 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
13536 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
13537
13538 end subroutine lw_kgb12
13539
13540! **************************************************************************
13541 subroutine lw_kgb13(rrtmg_unit)
13542! **************************************************************************
13543
13544 use rrlw_kg13, only : fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kao_mco2, kao_mco, &
13545 kbo_mo3, selfrefo, forrefo
13546
13547 implicit none
13548 save
13549
13550! Input
13551 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
13552
13553! Local
13554 character*80 errmess
13555 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
13556
13557! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
13558! and upper atmosphere.
13559! Planck fraction mapping levels:
13560! Lower: P=473.4280 mb, T = 259.83 K
13561! Upper: P=4.758820 mb, T = 250.85 K
13562
13563! The array KAO contains absorption coefs for each of the 16 g-intervals
13564! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb, temperatures, and ratios
13565! of water vapor to CO2. The first index in the array, JS, runs
13566! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
13567! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
13568! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
13569! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
13570! to that of gas2.
13571! The 2nd index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds
13572! to different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13573! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
13574! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature
13575! TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
13576! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
13577! to the reference pressure level (e.g. JP = 1 is for a
13578! pressure of 1053.63 mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
13579! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13580
13581! The array KAO_Mxx contains the absorption coefficient for
13582! a minor species at the 16 chosen g-values for a reference pressure
13583! level below 100~ mb. The first index in the array, JS, runs
13584! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
13585! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
13586! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
13587! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
13588! to that of gas2. The second index refers to temperature
13589! in 7.2 degree increments. For instance, JT = 1 refers to a
13590! temperature of 188.0, JT = 2 refers to 195.2, etc. The third index
13591! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13592
13593! The array KBO_Mxx contains the absorption coefficient for
13594! a minor species at the 16 chosen g-values for a reference pressure
13595! level above 100~ mb. The first index refers to temperature
13596! in 7.2 degree increments. For instance, JT = 1 refers to a
13597! temperature of 188.0, JT = 2 refers to 195.2, etc. The second index
13598! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13599
13600! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13601! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
13602! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
13603! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
13604! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13605
13606! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13607! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
13608! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
13609! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
13610! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13611
13612#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
13613
13614 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
13615 fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kao_mco2, kao_mco, kbo_mo3, selfrefo, forrefo
13616 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
13617 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefbo)
13618 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
13619 dm_bcast_macro(kao_mco2)
13620 dm_bcast_macro(kao_mco)
13621 dm_bcast_macro(kbo_mo3)
13622 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
13623 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
13624
13625 RETURN
136269010 CONTINUE
13627 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
13628 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
13629
13630 end subroutine lw_kgb13
13631
13632! **************************************************************************
13633 subroutine lw_kgb14(rrtmg_unit)
13634! **************************************************************************
13635
13636 use rrlw_kg14, only : fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo
13637
13638 implicit none
13639 save
13640
13641! Input
13642 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
13643
13644! Local
13645 character*80 errmess
13646 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
13647
13648! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
13649! and upper atmosphere.
13650! Planck fraction mapping levels:
13651! Lower: P = 142.5940 mb, T = 215.70 K
13652! Upper: P = 4.758820 mb, T = 250.85 K
13653
13654! The array KAO contains absorption coefs for each of the 16 g-intervals
13655! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb, temperatures, and ratios
13656! of water vapor to CO2. The first index in the array, JS, runs
13657! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
13658! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
13659! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
13660! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
13661! to that of gas2.
13662! The 2nd index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds
13663! to different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13664! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
13665! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature
13666! TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
13667! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
13668! to the reference pressure level (e.g. JP = 1 is for a
13669! pressure of 1053.63 mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
13670! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13671
13672! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
13673! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
13674! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
13675! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13676! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
13677! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
13678! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
13679! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
13680! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
13681! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
13682! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13683
13684! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13685! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
13686! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
13687! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
13688! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13689
13690! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13691! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
13692! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
13693! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
13694! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13695
13696#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
13697
13698 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
13699 fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo
13700 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
13701 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefbo)
13702 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
13703 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
13704 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
13705 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
13706
13707 RETURN
137089010 CONTINUE
13709 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
13710 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
13711
13712 end subroutine lw_kgb14
13713
13714! **************************************************************************
13715 subroutine lw_kgb15(rrtmg_unit)
13716! **************************************************************************
13717
13718 use rrlw_kg15, only : fracrefao, kao, kao_mn2, selfrefo, forrefo
13719
13720 implicit none
13721 save
13722
13723! Input
13724 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
13725
13726! Local
13727 character*80 errmess
13728 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
13729
13730! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
13731! and upper atmosphere.
13732! Planck fraction mapping levels:
13733! Lower: P = 1053. mb, T = 294.2 K
13734
13735! The array KAO contains absorption coefs for each of the 16 g-intervals
13736! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb, temperatures, and ratios
13737! of water vapor to CO2. The first index in the array, JS, runs
13738! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
13739! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
13740! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
13741! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
13742! to that of gas2.
13743! The 2nd index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds
13744! to different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13745! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
13746! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature
13747! TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
13748! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
13749! to the reference pressure level (e.g. JP = 1 is for a
13750! pressure of 1053.63 mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
13751! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13752
13753! The array KA_Mxx contains the absorption coefficient for
13754! a minor species at the 16 chosen g-values for a reference pressure
13755! level below 100~ mb. The first index in the array, JS, runs
13756! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
13757! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
13758! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
13759! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
13760! to that of gas2. The second index refers to temperature
13761! in 7.2 degree increments. For instance, JT = 1 refers to a
13762! temperature of 188.0, JT = 2 refers to 195.2, etc. The third index
13763! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13764
13765! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13766! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
13767! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
13768! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
13769! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13770
13771! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13772! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
13773! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
13774! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
13775! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13776
13777#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
13778
13779 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
13780 fracrefao, kao, kao_mn2, selfrefo, forrefo
13781 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
13782 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
13783 dm_bcast_macro(kao_mn2)
13784 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
13785 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
13786
13787 RETURN
137889010 CONTINUE
13789 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
13790 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
13791
13792 end subroutine lw_kgb15
13793
13794! **************************************************************************
13795 subroutine lw_kgb16(rrtmg_unit)
13796! **************************************************************************
13797
13798 use rrlw_kg16, only : fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo
13799
13800 implicit none
13801 save
13802
13803! Input
13804 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
13805
13806! Local
13807 character*80 errmess
13808 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
13809
13810! Arrays fracrefao and fracrefbo are the Planck fractions for the lower
13811! and upper atmosphere.
13812! Planck fraction mapping levels:
13813! Lower: P = 387.6100 mbar, T = 250.17 K
13814! Upper: P=95.58350 mb, T = 215.70 K
13815
13816! The array KAO contains absorption coefs for each of the 16 g-intervals
13817! for a range of pressure levels > ~100mb, temperatures, and ratios
13818! of water vapor to CO2. The first index in the array, JS, runs
13819! from 1 to 10, and corresponds to different gas column amount ratios,
13820! as expressed through the binary species parameter eta, defined as
13821! eta = gas1/(gas1 + (rat) * gas2), where rat is the
13822! ratio of the reference MLS column amount value of gas 1
13823! to that of gas2.
13824! The 2nd index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds
13825! to different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13826! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
13827! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature
13828! TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
13829! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
13830! to the reference pressure level (e.g. JP = 1 is for a
13831! pressure of 1053.63 mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
13832! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13833
13834! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
13835! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
13836! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
13837! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
13838! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
13839! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
13840! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
13841! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
13842! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
13843! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
13844! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
13845
13846! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13847! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
13848! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
13849! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
13850! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13851
13852! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
13853! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
13854! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
13855! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
13856! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
13857
13858#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
13859
13860 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
13861 fracrefao, fracrefbo, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo
13862 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefao)
13863 dm_bcast_macro(fracrefbo)
13864 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
13865 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
13866 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
13867 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
13868
13869 RETURN
138709010 CONTINUE
13871 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_lw: error reading RRTMG_LW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
13872 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
13873
13874 end subroutine lw_kgb16
13875
13876#endif
13877!ldf end (2013-03-15).
13878
13879!===============================================================================
13880 subroutine relcalc(ncol, pcols, pver, t, landfrac, landm, icefrac, rel, snowh)
13881!-----------------------------------------------------------------------
13882!
13883! Purpose:
13884! Compute cloud water size
13885!
13886! Method:
13887! analytic formula following the formulation originally developed by J. T. Kiehl
13888!
13889! Author: Phil Rasch
13890!
13891!-----------------------------------------------------------------------
13892 implicit none
13893!------------------------------Arguments--------------------------------
13894!
13895! Input arguments
13896!
13897 integer, intent(in) :: ncol
13898 integer, intent(in) :: pcols, pver
13899 real, intent(in) :: landfrac(pcols) ! Land fraction
13900 real, intent(in) :: icefrac(pcols) ! Ice fraction
13901 real, intent(in) :: snowh(pcols) ! Snow depth over land, water equivalent (m)
13902 real, intent(in) :: landm(pcols) ! Land fraction ramping to zero over ocean
13903 real, intent(in) :: t(pcols,pver) ! Temperature
13904
13905!
13906! Output arguments
13907!
13908 real, intent(out) :: rel(pcols,pver) ! Liquid effective drop size (microns)
13909!
13910!---------------------------Local workspace-----------------------------
13911!
13912 integer i,k ! Lon, lev indices
13913 real tmelt ! freezing temperature of fresh water (K)
13914 real rliqland ! liquid drop size if over land
13915 real rliqocean ! liquid drop size if over ocean
13916 real rliqice ! liquid drop size if over sea ice
13917!
13918!-----------------------------------------------------------------------
13919!
13920 tmelt = 273.16
13921 rliqocean = 14.0
13922 rliqice = 14.0
13923 rliqland = 8.0
13924 do k=1,pver
13925 do i=1,ncol
13926! jrm Reworked effective radius algorithm
13927 ! Start with temperature-dependent value appropriate for continental air
13928 ! Note: findmcnew has a pressure dependence here
13929 rel(i,k) = rliqland + (rliqocean-rliqland) * min(1.0,max(0.0,(tmelt-t(i,k))*0.05))
13930 ! Modify for snow depth over land
13931 rel(i,k) = rel(i,k) + (rliqocean-rel(i,k)) * min(1.0,max(0.0,snowh(i)*10.))
13932 ! Ramp between polluted value over land to clean value over ocean.
13933 rel(i,k) = rel(i,k) + (rliqocean-rel(i,k)) * min(1.0,max(0.0,1.0-landm(i)))
13934 ! Ramp between the resultant value and a sea ice value in the presence of ice.
13935 rel(i,k) = rel(i,k) + (rliqice-rel(i,k)) * min(1.0,max(0.0,icefrac(i)))
13936! end jrm
13937 end do
13938 end do
13939 end subroutine relcalc
13940!===============================================================================
13941 subroutine reicalc(ncol, pcols, pver, t, re)
13942 !
13943
13944 integer, intent(in) :: ncol, pcols, pver
13945 real, intent(out) :: re(pcols,pver)
13946 real, intent(in) :: t(pcols,pver)
13947 real corr
13948 integer i
13949 integer k
13950 integer index
13951 !
13952 ! Tabulated values of re(T) in the temperature interval
13953 ! 180 K -- 274 K; hexagonal columns assumed:
13954 !
13955 !
13956 do k=1,pver
13957 do i=1,ncol
13958 index = int(t(i,k)-179.)
13959 index = min(max(index,1),94)
13960 corr = t(i,k) - int(t(i,k))
13961 re(i,k) = retab(index)*(1.-corr) &
13962 +retab(index+1)*corr
13963 ! re(i,k) = amax1(amin1(re(i,k),30.),10.)
13964 end do
13965 end do
13966 !
13967 return
13968 end subroutine reicalc
13969!------------------------------------------------------------------
13970
13971END MODULE module_ra_rrtmg_lw
